intro: Puccinellia fragiliflora, commonly known as slender-flowered puccinellia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are often arranged in spikelets, and it is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in its native habitat. Puccinellia fragiliflora plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its ecological niche.
